actions.text: Referred to House Committee on House Administration.

official_title: Resolution providing for the creation of congressional senior citizen internships.

summary.text: Authorizes each Member of the House of Representatives and the Resident Commissioner from Puerto Rico and the Delegates from the District of Columbia, Guam, and the Virgin Islands to hire for four weeks, each year, two additional employees to be known as "senior citizen interns" who will serve in either the congressional district offices or in the District of Columbia. Requires each such intern to be sixty-five years of age or older. Provides each member with a gross allowance of $750, payable from the contingent fund of the House, from which payment will be made to each such intern at the rate of $70 per week.

titles.title: Resolution providing for the creation of congressional senior citizen internships.
